Financial Stress Index Signal

Market-wide financial stress and systemic risk conditions.

As of 2026-01-10

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Financial Stress Index signal is currently in a Neutral regime as of 2026-01-02 (1). This indicates moderate financial conditions, having eased from a recent Bearish phase.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The latest STLFSI4 reading is -0.5656, with a robust z-score of 0.167 (1).
  • The signal transitioned from Bearish to Neutral in late December, reflecting a stabilization of financial conditions, with the z-score moving away from the +0.5 Bearish threshold.
  • Conditional Invalidation: A sustained rise in the robust z-score above +0.5 or the STLFSI4 level crossing above 0 would shift the signal back to Bearish (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Financial stress remains neutral, supported by the z-score staying within the -0.5 to +0.5 range (1).
  • Upside secondary: A sustained drop in the z-score below -0.5, coupled with further negative STLFSI4 values, would signal Bullish (risk-on) conditions (1).
  • Downside residual: A rise in the STLFSI4 above 0 or the z-score above +0.5 would shift to Bearish (risk-off) conditions (1).

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Tactical (weeks). The weekly frequency and risk-on/risk-off sentiment focus make it relevant for near-term financial conditions (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium. This signal offers a direct gauge of financial stress, crucial for risk assessment, but should be contextualized with broader macro themes.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Liquidity, sentiment.
  • Cycle position: Mid-cycle to late-cycle, as financial stress typically builds during these phases.
  • Typical interaction: Often moves inversely with `Credit Conditions` (2) and `VIX` (3), and correlates with `Yield Curve Slope` (4) inversions.

Data & References:

  • St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (STLFSI4), latest observation date 2026-01-02 (1).
  • The latest STLFSI4 value (-0.5656) and its robust z-score (0.167) were most influential in determining the current state.
  • `Credit Spreads Signal` (5), `Market Volatility (VIX) Signal` (3).
